oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Rita Salter interview - Irene Murray - Voice Of America - unedited
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording of an interview with Rita Salters (Country Music Hall of Fame), conducted by Irene Murray for a radio segment titled "Voices Of America" created for a Russian (Soviet Union) audience.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Irene Murray introduces the Voice Of America interview segment and Rita Salter -- (00:26) Salter talks about living in Nashville for two years with her husband, who is a songwriter and artist -- Salter talks about working in public relations at the Country Music Hall of Fame -- (01:00) Salter talks about the CMA and the Country Music Hall of Fame and how it started -- (02:30) Salter talks about the museum's collection -- (03:20) Salter talks about the museum's open library, and how music classes are starting up -- (04:15) Salter goes through her typical work day on a Saturday -- (05:00) Salter talks about some of the famous artifacts and displays they have at the museum -- (06:30) Salter talks about country music and the museum being open to people of all races and colors, and Charley Pride and Deford Bailey being a staple head for the black community -- (07:50) Salter talks about the museum moving buildings soon, and why they are -- (09:45) Salter talks about the process for how members of the hall of fame get inducted and the CMA -- (13:35) Salter talks about NARAS sponsored seminars in the museum -- (15:00) Salter talks about some frequent questions among visitors about country music artists -- (15:30) Salter talks about the simulated recording session display in the museum -- (16:30) Salter talks about the most popular exhibits in the museum -- (17:00) Salter talks about Minnie Pearl's hat collection in the museum -- (18:00) Salter talks about her husband being a struggling songwriter and singer, who almost has a recording contract, and was featured in a German country music film -- (19:10) Salter talks about her and her husband's professional journey in Nashville -- (21:20) Salter talks about supporting her husband and her while he focuses on his songwriting career -- (22:25) Salter talks about the various tours the museum offers -- (22:50) Salter talks about the various nationalities that come to visit the museum -- (24:10) Salter welcomes any Russian citizens to come visit the museum and the interview concludes
